channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Park sports equipment broken completely, 7th February
item.description:
Please replace the open air park ,,sports equipment,, in the central venue park on Kelly Avenue. Unfortunately it's completely destroyed by some aggressive vandalism. Could be great to install CCTV cameras near the park sports equipment.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Commercial Way, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in the middle of the pedestrian crossing at the junction of Hurst Road and Dorchester Avenue., 7th February
item.description:
Pothole in the road on the pedestrian crossing situated at the junction of Hurst Road and Dorchester Avenue. Likely to cause injury if anyone catches their foot in the pothole.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penfold Lane, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Albany Street NW1, 7th February
item.description:
Due to road works taking out the whole section of the road and temporary traffic light issues which is not timely assessed based on the traffic flow and the drivers waiting for a long time behind the red light some drivers jumping the red line and this can result in an accident. The issue needs to be addressed properly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Albany Street, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Fly tipped Large Bin with rubbish in., 7th February
item.description:
There has been a large bin that has fly tipped on the first tree on the corner of Highfield Road and The Fairway. It has general rubbish in. It has Veolia Environmental Services UK PLC on the side of the bin. It's been there for about 2 Weeks.

item.title: Large tonne bag of rubbish left, 7th February
item.description:
Following a house clearance from number 5 Ridley Road,this rubbish has been dumped by the previous tenants family with no regard to the people that live in Ridley Road.We are constantly having to report rubbish dumped by residents from surrounding roads or in this case previous tenants.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ridley Road, East Wickham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light not working, 7th February
item.description:
You came and installed a new lamp post at the end of my driveway with no prior warning, leaving us now with 2 lamp posts, neither of them work. The new post is even closer to the property causing it to be more difficult to enter and exit the driveway, especially in the dark as the road is already narrow and we have cars that park directly opposite that cause obstruction as the area is used when there are no bays available.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Silver Spring Close, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on comms box in Westgate Rd, just N of The Avenue, 7th February
item.description:
Graffiti has recently appeared on the green comms box on Westgate Road near Banavie Gardens, on the West side of Westgate Road, just North of the junction with The Avenue. Please can it be removed - thanks!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westgate Road, Shortlands, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned white towelling item by the bus shelter, southbound in Shortlands Rd, Shortlands on the opp side of the road from The Glen side road, 7th February
item.description:
Abandoned white towelling item by the bus shelter, southbound in Shortlands Rd, Shortlands on the opp side of the road from The Glen side road. It has been there 3 days.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shortlands Road, Shortlands, Greater London

item.title: Absolute pit, 7th February
item.description:
Hill View Drive and pretty much all the roads round it are full of decaying litter and general filth in the kerbsides and gutters. I used to litterpick the while area but havent been able to and cant help but notice that it hardly ever gets done. I appreciate parked cars make it difficult but tbh there were hardly any cars in Hill View Drive today. It looks utterly filthy. Theres also a bus stop at junction of Hill View Drive and Miles Drive which is an absolute sea of rubbish. Ive seen rats in Hill View Drive on numerous occasions because the litter contains discarded food. IT ALL NEEDS CLEARING. The wet weather makes it worse. Its now like a food/litter/filth/leaves paste that washes down gutters and blocks them
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Belmarsh Road, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drains, 7th February
item.description:
